summary: Can you do future romance reading for jin BTS? I was told by someone who can predict things that jin will have an actress as his...
question: Can you do future romance reading for jin BTS? I was told by someone who can predict things that jin will have an actress as his wife, is that true? if it's true, do you mind to describe what kind of person is she? I'm worried since he doesn't give any hint about having into relationship right now, but I really want him to have someone special to make him happy lol I'm sorry if I sound so weird
answer:
I don’t do any readings that go into specific details about personal relationships, but I did pull some cards for the energy surrounding any future relationships that could lead to marriage specifically. 

Now, I’ll be honest, I had to pull a few times because some things seemed a bit questionable. It could be that he has a couple of karmic relationships where things aren’t the absolute best, but the above cards show a specific union where he will be with someone who vibes with him really well. Quite literally this could be a soulmate connection, but it’s one that’s very down the line. He will have a few relationships before this one and that Magician is like, “Good lord, it took everything to find you.” That’s not to say that any relationships that he had, has, or will have prior to this one are bad or no good all together, it just means that this one is the one that will fit him the best. This person might be a fire sign as those two wands are the common ground for them.

summary: how do u see Jungkook's film/photography moving forward? or taehyungs photography? actually are any of the others interested...
question: how do u see Jungkook's film/photography moving forward? or taehyungs photography? actually are any of the others interested like that in things not music related I havent thought about it
answer:
Oh my god, yeah, 100% the guys are interested in plenty of things outside of music. When I did his Elemental Alignment I talked about how painting was actually something he needed to look into and I feel like he might actually jump to that at some point. He’s a bit more experimental, he does a lot of things to try and express himself creatively and photography is just one of them. He is extremely talented with it though, so I’m sure he’ll continue to focus on that especially while they are working and on tour, as you don’t need to lug around entire canvases with you, you can just have your camera.

In Kook’s Elemental Alignment reading I mentioned that his filming or his process of creating could experience a bit of a hiccup because of how he can sometimes take into consideration too much of what other people expect of him especially when it comes to things that have his name on them. It’s not like he’s going to stop making them, it’s more like he’ll feel a bit more stumped or his personal flare that he had with the first one could taper off. However, I think the more comfortable he gets with it or the more encouragement he has to express himself as naturally as possible the more his creativity can flow. Like, the reason the first GCF was so lovely and really touched everyone was because he did it without any critical thinking of his work, like he hadn’t put anything out so there were no opinions to consider while he was making it, he was just putting his heart and soul into as he saw fit. He definitely did that as well with the others, but there is a noticeable concern now with needing things to be a bit more polished and pleasing for the viewer rather than just something that allows him to capture something that he finds meaningful and important.

As for his photography, I think it’s the same with Taehyung where it’s a bit more experimental and it’s something that is more in line with a hobby. I think he genuinely does like video editing/filmmaking a bit more as he has more control over it and he can kind of express more of himself a little easier through that by adding more of his personal taste to it. Photography, when you’re still in the beginning stages of learning the ins and outs, can be a bit more technical, so I’m sure he finds a little bit more freedom in making his short films. Plus that rampant sentimentality that he has can be used much better with videos where there are basically millions of photos in one go, lol.

blog.name: random-fangirl-213
blog.title: Random Fangirl
blog.description:
A fangirl, who writes shitty fan fics
 ● Request are open ●

summary: Vintage Shop (RM X Reader) (One Shot)
title: Vintage Shop (RM X Reader) (One Shot)
body:
Title: Vintage Shop
Idol: RM/Namjoon (BTS) ft. Xiumin/Minseok (EXO)
Genre: Angst

Third Person’s POV

“And BTS won another pri-” (Y/N) turned off the little TV, of the vintage shop she worked at.

(Y/N) groaned, not wanting to hear another story about BTS, or anything related to them.

“BTS, again?” Solji asked, referring to the TV. “Yes, ugh!” (Y/N) said, while slamming her head on the counter, repeatedly.

“(Y/N), you better stop doing that, before you kill all your brain cells.” Solji said, while grabbing (Y/N)’s head, preventing her from doing more damage to her brain, or its cells.

“I don’t care.” (Y/N) said. “Maybe I can forget about him.” “He really hurt you, didn’t he?” Solji said, while grabbing a magazine. “Yes.” (Y/N) looked at the magazine.

Namjoon’s (BTS) new flame?

(Y/N) groaned, and slammed her head on the counter, again. Solji looked at her, and then at her magazine.

“Oh, (N/N), I’m sorry.” She quickly put away her magazine. “I didn’t mean to do that.”

“I know.” (Y/N) grumbled. “You just wanted to read your magazine.” She slammed her head on the counter, and hard.

Not that she cared though, maybe she could forget about him.

“You really should stop doing that. I think, you’re about to kill your last brain cells.” Solji said, and (Y/N) stopped slamming her head against the counter.

“Not that there were many to kill, but you know.” Solji patted (Y/N)’s head. “Tea?” “Tea would be lovely.” (Y/N) said, while fixing her blouse.

Solji and (Y/N) walked to the back of the shop, where a little vintage bar was made, by the owner.

Solji asked (Y/N) how she met Namjoon, so she told her.

- Flashback -

Cling!

(Y/N) looked up from the records she was sorting, and saw her cousin with his bandmate/friend, entering the little vintage shop she worked.

“Hey (N/N)!” Her cousin, Jin, waved, (Y/N) nodded. “Hey Jin oppa.” And put another record on its place.

“What are you doing here?” (Y/N) asked, even though she was not intrested. “I thought you had band practice or something.”

“Nah, we just wanted a break.” Jin said, while looking at some records.

“That still does not awnser my question.” She stated blankly. “Can’t I visit my favourite cousin?” Jin put his head on her shoulder.

“I’m you’re only cousin, Jin oppa.” (Y/N) shrugged his head of her shoulder, and Jin pouted.

“Don’t be like that, (N/N).” Jin hugged her, causing (Y/N) to drop the records. “JIN!” She scold him, and pushed him off of her.

“I’ll help you.” A voice said,and grabbed a few records. (Y/N) looked at the owner of the voice a hot man, probably her age.

“Thanks, uh?” (Y/N) said, while also grapping some records. “Namjoon.” The boy, Namjoon, said, and gave her the records.

“Thank you, Namjoon.” “No problem.” (Y/N) checked the records, to see if they were still impact.

“Jin, you ass hole.” (Y/N) said, when she noted a crack in one of the records.

“What? What did I do?” Jin asked confused. “You broke a record! And breaking means buying.”

“I don’t have any money with me.” Jin sighed. “Why does that not surprise me.” (Y/N) mumbled, and Jin sheepishly smiled.

“Don’t worry, I will pay.” Namjoon said. “What? No! Jin oppa broke the record, he needs to pay for it.” (Y/N) shook her head.

“It’s fine, Jin hyung will pay me back later.” Namjoon assured her, as they walked towards the checkout counter.

“How much?” “Uh, $5,50.” (Y/N) said, and Namjoon gave me the money, and I she gave him the broken record.

“But we must leave now, (N/N).” Jin put an arm around Namjoon’s shoulder.

“I thought you would never leave.” (Y/N) mumbled under her breath, Jin chuckled.

“Bye (N/N).” Jin said. “Bye (Y/N).” Namjoon waved, (Y/N) waved back. “Bye Jin oppa, bye Namjoon.” Then she noticed a white piece of paper between the money.

You’re cute
Call me
xxx-xxxx-xxx

Xx Namjoon

- End flashback -

“That’s so cute.” Solji said, and took a sip from her tea, (Y/N) nodded.

“But that does not explain your hate for him.” Solji said, (Y/N) sighed. “Well we went on a few dates, and then he asked me to be his girlfriend.” She continued.

“And of course I said yes, and we were in an amazing relationship for almost two years.” (Y/N) took a sip from her tea, as Solji nodded.

“And then they left, to go on tour with GOT7. And after that I never heard from Namjoon again. Until a year ago, from Jackson. He told me that Namjoon got a girlfriend, named Mia or something.”

“That ass hole.” Solji said, and slammed her cup on the table. But before she could say more, the bell above the door rang.

“I thought you put the sign on ‘closed’?” (Y/N) asked Solji, who put down her cup, and looked at (Y/N).

“I did, I mean we wanted a peaceful lunchbreak.” Solji said, while standing up. “I will check.” (Y/N) smiled at her thankfully.

After a few moments, Solji came running back.

“(Y/N)!” Solji seemed a little panicked. “Unnie!? What’s wrong?” (Y/N) asked concerned.

“Is the costumer being unfriendly?” “No, no, no.” Solji quickly shook her head. “Look.”

Solji led (Y/N) to being the bookshelf, which separated the shop and the bar. She looked through the books, and saw someone she never thought, she would see again.

Kim fucking Namjoon.

“What is he doing here?” (Y/N) hissed, making sure Namjoon couldn’t hear them. “I don’t know.” Solji said, shrugging.

“But he’s asking for you.” (Y/N) groaned, not wanting to talk to the person who broke her heart, and just left her, like she was nothing.

“Say I’m not here.” (Y/N) said. “But he said he knows you’re here.” Solji said, making (Y/N) groan.

“He said something about Jin, and that he told him that you still worked here, and this time.” Solji explained.

“Oh, so Jin oppa is behind this. He’s dead, don’t care he’s my cousin. He’s so fucking dead.” I groaned.

“Say that I’m sick or something.” (Y/N) hissed, and Solji nodded. “Sure thing.” And Solji walked back towards the front of the shop.

(Y/N) watched through the space between the books. She could not hear what they were saying, but it seemed like Namjoon did not believe Solji.

At some point Namjoon shook his head, and walked towards the back of the shop, while Solji tried to stop him, but she was too weak.

(Y/N) tried to hide behind the bar, but was too late.

“(Y/N)?”

(Y/N) slowly turned around, and glared at the owner of the voice, Namjoon.

“What?” She spat, and Solji slowly backed away, and dissapeard to the backroom, of the shop. Not wanting to get involved.

“I’m sorry.” Namjoon said. “You should be.” (Y/N) hissed. “Can we please start over again?” Namjoon asked.

“No, Namjoon. You left me, remember.” (Y/N) put her hand on her hip.

“I know.” Namjoon sighed. “And it was, no is, the biggest mistake I ever made.” “Jackson told me something else. He told me you moved on, with a girl named, Mia or something.” (Y/N) glared at him.

“It’s Nia, and yeah, we’ve dated for a while. But I couldn’t stop thinking about you.” Namjoon put his hands in his pockets.

“Oh, and now, after more then a year, you thought, 'maybe (Y/N) wants me back’!?” (Y/N) said, trying not to let the tears fall.

“Well I have newsflash for you.” She said. “I moved on! I have a boyfriend, a really sweet one.” Namjoon’s looked at her, a frown on his face.

“A boyfriend?” Namjoon asked, as (Y/N) nodded. “Yeah, I think you know him. His name is Minseok.”

“M-Minseok?” Namjoon asked. “As in your friend Minseok?” (Y/N) nodded again.

“Yes, and he treats me better then you ever did.” I half lied, but I wouldn’t let Namjoon know that.

Cling!

Namjoon looked at the door, and (Y/N) looked at the clock, 3:30 p.m., the end of her shift, which ment that Minseok came to pick her up.

“(Y/N)?” Minseok called out. “Min!” The girl called back, and walked past Namjoon, towards the front of the shop.

“I missed you.” (Y/N) said to Minseok, while hugging him. “I missed you too, princess.” Minseok kissed her forehead.

“Who’s that?” Minseok asked, and pointed at Namjoon. “Namjoon, an old friend.” (Y/N) shrugged, and Minseok nodded.

“Ready to go, princess?” Minseok asked, (Y/N) nodded. “Sure, bye Namjoon.” And with that Minseok and (Y/N) left.

“I moved on.”

Those three words kept haunting Namjoon.

He had lost her.

For good.

A/N

I hope you enjoyed this one shot
Feel free to leave a comment about the story, a question or a request

Stay amazing!

reblog.comment:
Title: Vintage Shop
Idol: RM/Namjoon (BTS) ft. Xiumin/Minseok (EXO)
Genre: Angst

Third Person’s POV

“And BTS won another pri-” (Y/N) turned off the little TV, of the vintage shop she worked at.

(Y/N) groaned, not wanting to hear another story about BTS, or anything related to them.

“BTS, again?” Solji asked, referring to the TV. “Yes, ugh!” (Y/N) said, while slamming her head on the counter, repeatedly.

“(Y/N), you better stop doing that, before you kill all your brain cells.” Solji said, while grabbing (Y/N)’s head, preventing her from doing more damage to her brain, or its cells.

“I don’t care.” (Y/N) said. “Maybe I can forget about him.” “He really hurt you, didn’t he?” Solji said, while grabbing a magazine. “Yes.” (Y/N) looked at the magazine.

Namjoon’s (BTS) new flame?

(Y/N) groaned, and slammed her head on the counter, again. Solji looked at her, and then at her magazine.

“Oh, (N/N), I’m sorry.” She quickly put away her magazine. “I didn’t mean to do that.”

“I know.” (Y/N) grumbled. “You just wanted to read your magazine.” She slammed her head on the counter, and hard.

Not that she cared though, maybe she could forget about him.

“You really should stop doing that. I think, you’re about to kill your last brain cells.” Solji said, and (Y/N) stopped slamming her head against the counter.

“Not that there were many to kill, but you know.” Solji patted (Y/N)’s head. “Tea?” “Tea would be lovely.” (Y/N) said, while fixing her blouse.

Solji and (Y/N) walked to the back of the shop, where a little vintage bar was made, by the owner.

Solji asked (Y/N) how she met Namjoon, so she told her.

- Flashback -

Cling!

(Y/N) looked up from the records she was sorting, and saw her cousin with his bandmate/friend, entering the little vintage shop she worked.

“Hey (N/N)!” Her cousin, Jin, waved, (Y/N) nodded. “Hey Jin oppa.” And put another record on its place.

“What are you doing here?” (Y/N) asked, even though she was not intrested. “I thought you had band practice or something.”

“Nah, we just wanted a break.” Jin said, while looking at some records.

“That still does not awnser my question.” She stated blankly. “Can’t I visit my favourite cousin?” Jin put his head on her shoulder.

“I’m you’re only cousin, Jin oppa.” (Y/N) shrugged his head of her shoulder, and Jin pouted.

“Don’t be like that, (N/N).” Jin hugged her, causing (Y/N) to drop the records. “JIN!” She scold him, and pushed him off of her.

“I’ll help you.” A voice said,and grabbed a few records. (Y/N) looked at the owner of the voice a hot man, probably her age.

“Thanks, uh?” (Y/N) said, while also grapping some records. “Namjoon.” The boy, Namjoon, said, and gave her the records.

“Thank you, Namjoon.” “No problem.” (Y/N) checked the records, to see if they were still impact.

“Jin, you ass hole.” (Y/N) said, when she noted a crack in one of the records.

“What? What did I do?” Jin asked confused. “You broke a record! And breaking means buying.”

“I don’t have any money with me.” Jin sighed. “Why does that not surprise me.” (Y/N) mumbled, and Jin sheepishly smiled.

“Don’t worry, I will pay.” Namjoon said. “What? No! Jin oppa broke the record, he needs to pay for it.” (Y/N) shook her head.

“It’s fine, Jin hyung will pay me back later.” Namjoon assured her, as they walked towards the checkout counter.

“How much?” “Uh, $5,50.” (Y/N) said, and Namjoon gave me the money, and I she gave him the broken record.

“But we must leave now, (N/N).” Jin put an arm around Namjoon’s shoulder.

“I thought you would never leave.” (Y/N) mumbled under her breath, Jin chuckled.

“Bye (N/N).” Jin said. “Bye (Y/N).” Namjoon waved, (Y/N) waved back. “Bye Jin oppa, bye Namjoon.” Then she noticed a white piece of paper between the money.

You’re cute
Call me
xxx-xxxx-xxx

Xx Namjoon

- End flashback -

“That’s so cute.” Solji said, and took a sip from her tea, (Y/N) nodded.

“But that does not explain your hate for him.” Solji said, (Y/N) sighed. “Well we went on a few dates, and then he asked me to be his girlfriend.” She continued.

“And of course I said yes, and we were in an amazing relationship for almost two years.” (Y/N) took a sip from her tea, as Solji nodded.

“And then they left, to go on tour with GOT7. And after that I never heard from Namjoon again. Until a year ago, from Jackson. He told me that Namjoon got a girlfriend, named Mia or something.”

“That ass hole.” Solji said, and slammed her cup on the table. But before she could say more, the bell above the door rang.

“I thought you put the sign on ‘closed’?” (Y/N) asked Solji, who put down her cup, and looked at (Y/N).

“I did, I mean we wanted a peaceful lunchbreak.” Solji said, while standing up. “I will check.” (Y/N) smiled at her thankfully.

After a few moments, Solji came running back.

“(Y/N)!” Solji seemed a little panicked. “Unnie!? What’s wrong?” (Y/N) asked concerned.

“Is the costumer being unfriendly?” “No, no, no.” Solji quickly shook her head. “Look.”

Solji led (Y/N) to being the bookshelf, which separated the shop and the bar. She looked through the books, and saw someone she never thought, she would see again.

Kim fucking Namjoon.

“What is he doing here?” (Y/N) hissed, making sure Namjoon couldn’t hear them. “I don’t know.” Solji said, shrugging.

“But he’s asking for you.” (Y/N) groaned, not wanting to talk to the person who broke her heart, and just left her, like she was nothing.

“Say I’m not here.” (Y/N) said. “But he said he knows you’re here.” Solji said, making (Y/N) groan.

“He said something about Jin, and that he told him that you still worked here, and this time.” Solji explained.

“Oh, so Jin oppa is behind this. He’s dead, don’t care he’s my cousin. He’s so fucking dead.” I groaned.

“Say that I’m sick or something.” (Y/N) hissed, and Solji nodded. “Sure thing.” And Solji walked back towards the front of the shop.

(Y/N) watched through the space between the books. She could not hear what they were saying, but it seemed like Namjoon did not believe Solji.

At some point Namjoon shook his head, and walked towards the back of the shop, while Solji tried to stop him, but she was too weak.

(Y/N) tried to hide behind the bar, but was too late.

“(Y/N)?”

(Y/N) slowly turned around, and glared at the owner of the voice, Namjoon.

“What?” She spat, and Solji slowly backed away, and dissapeard to the backroom, of the shop. Not wanting to get involved.

“I’m sorry.” Namjoon said. “You should be.” (Y/N) hissed. “Can we please start over again?” Namjoon asked.

“No, Namjoon. You left me, remember.” (Y/N) put her hand on her hip.

“I know.” Namjoon sighed. “And it was, no is, the biggest mistake I ever made.” “Jackson told me something else. He told me you moved on, with a girl named, Mia or something.” (Y/N) glared at him.

“It’s Nia, and yeah, we’ve dated for a while. But I couldn’t stop thinking about you.” Namjoon put his hands in his pockets.

“Oh, and now, after more then a year, you thought, 'maybe (Y/N) wants me back’!?” (Y/N) said, trying not to let the tears fall.

“Well I have newsflash for you.” She said. “I moved on! I have a boyfriend, a really sweet one.” Namjoon’s looked at her, a frown on his face.

“A boyfriend?” Namjoon asked, as (Y/N) nodded. “Yeah, I think you know him. His name is Minseok.”

“M-Minseok?” Namjoon asked. “As in your friend Minseok?” (Y/N) nodded again.

“Yes, and he treats me better then you ever did.” I half lied, but I wouldn’t let Namjoon know that.

Cling!

Namjoon looked at the door, and (Y/N) looked at the clock, 3:30 p.m., the end of her shift, which ment that Minseok came to pick her up.

“(Y/N)?” Minseok called out. “Min!” The girl called back, and walked past Namjoon, towards the front of the shop.

“I missed you.” (Y/N) said to Minseok, while hugging him. “I missed you too, princess.” Minseok kissed her forehead.

“Who’s that?” Minseok asked, and pointed at Namjoon. “Namjoon, an old friend.” (Y/N) shrugged, and Minseok nodded.

“Ready to go, princess?” Minseok asked, (Y/N) nodded. “Sure, bye Namjoon.” And with that Minseok and (Y/N) left.

“I moved on.”

Those three words kept haunting Namjoon.

He had lost her.

For good.

A/N

I hope you enjoyed this one shot
Feel free to leave a comment about the story, a question or a request

Stay amazing!

“Is the costumer being unfriendly?” “No, no, no.” Solji quickly shook her head. “Look.”

Solji led (Y/N) to being the bookshelf, which separated the shop and the bar. She looked through the books, and saw someone she never thought, she would see again.

Kim fucking Namjoon.

“What is he doing here?” (Y/N) hissed, making sure Namjoon couldn’t hear them. “I don’t know.” Solji said, shrugging.

“But he’s asking for you.” (Y/N) groaned, not wanting to talk to the person who broke her heart, and just left her, like she was nothing.

“Say I’m not here.” (Y/N) said. “But he said he knows you’re here.” Solji said, making (Y/N) groan.

“He said something about Jin, and that he told him that you still worked here, and this time.” Solji explained.

“Oh, so Jin oppa is behind this. He’s dead, don’t care he’s my cousin. He’s so fucking dead.” I groaned.

“Say that I’m sick or something.” (Y/N) hissed, and Solji nodded. “Sure thing.” And Solji walked back towards the front of the shop.

(Y/N) watched through the space between the books. She could not hear what they were saying, but it seemed like Namjoon did not believe Solji.

At some point Namjoon shook his head, and walked towards the back of the shop, while Solji tried to stop him, but she was too weak.

(Y/N) tried to hide behind the bar, but was too late.

“(Y/N)?”

(Y/N) slowly turned around, and glared at the owner of the voice, Namjoon.

“What?” She spat, and Solji slowly backed away, and dissapeard to the backroom, of the shop. Not wanting to get involved.

“I’m sorry.” Namjoon said. “You should be.” (Y/N) hissed. “Can we please start over again?” Namjoon asked.

“No, Namjoon. You left me, remember.” (Y/N) put her hand on her hip.

“I know.” Namjoon sighed. “And it was, no is, the biggest mistake I ever made.” “Jackson told me something else. He told me you moved on, with a girl named, Mia or something.” (Y/N) glared at him.

“It’s Nia, and yeah, we’ve dated for a while. But I couldn’t stop thinking about you.” Namjoon put his hands in his pockets.

“Oh, and now, after more then a year, you thought, 'maybe (Y/N) wants me back’!?” (Y/N) said, trying not to let the tears fall.

“Well I have newsflash for you.” She said. “I moved on! I have a boyfriend, a really sweet one.” Namjoon’s looked at her, a frown on his face.

“A boyfriend?” Namjoon asked, as (Y/N) nodded. “Yeah, I think you know him. His name is Minseok.”

“M-Minseok?” Namjoon asked. “As in your friend Minseok?” (Y/N) nodded again.

“Yes, and he treats me better then you ever did.” I half lied, but I wouldn’t let Namjoon know that.

Cling!

Namjoon looked at the door, and (Y/N) looked at the clock, 3:30 p.m., the end of her shift, which ment that Minseok came to pick her up.

“(Y/N)?” Minseok called out. “Min!” The girl called back, and walked past Namjoon, towards the front of the shop.

“I missed you.” (Y/N) said to Minseok, while hugging him. “I missed you too, princess.” Minseok kissed her forehead.

“Who’s that?” Minseok asked, and pointed at Namjoon. “Namjoon, an old friend.” (Y/N) shrugged, and Minseok nodded.

“Ready to go, princess?” Minseok asked, (Y/N) nodded. “Sure, bye Namjoon.” And with that Minseok and (Y/N) left.

“I moved on.”

Those three words kept haunting Namjoon.

He had lost her.

For good.

A/N
